Subject: NEAT + weight decay
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=234280965; y=AApbi4p_Vic9jlWDgfIuLHcrAtANaalnY0y6n3SWTN2B4i0gCMaTqw
X-Yahoo-Profile: daniel.larkin

All,

A short question...

It seems to be accepted that regularisation methods (weight decay etc) can be
beneficial from a generalisation perspective in ANNs. Obviously in the NEAT
paradigm, smaller topologies are favoured, but NEAT doesn't necessarily favour
smaller absolute weight values (unless I'm missing something). What are the
opinions of those that have explored this? Did it have any noticeable effect? 

Daniel
